item.title: October 7 Will Be a Sad Day for Need for Speed Fans
item.description:
Need for Speed fans should take note that Need for Speed Rivals is shutting down on October 7. First released in 2013, Need for Speed Rivals was developed by Ghost Games and Criterion Games and earned mostly positive reviews. Appreciation for Need for Speed Rivals only grew as its sequels were released to a less-than-stellar reception, something the franchise hasn't really recovered completely from even now.

Need for Speed Rivals earned particular praise for its online multiplayer functionality. Using the AllDrive feature, Need for Speed Rivals allows players to experience its open world with others, while also featuring more traditional online racing game modes. Sadly, time is running out for fans that want to continue enjoying Need for Speed Rivals ' online multiplayer, as the server shutdown date is right around the corner.

The Need for Speed Rivals servers will be shutting down on Tuesday, October 7. From that point forward, Need for Speed fans will no longer be able to enjoy any of Rivals ' online features. There will still be offline content available to play, but since the game was largely built with online multiplayer in mind, it will effectively be dead. Needless to say, anyone that has yet to get their fill of Need for Speed Rivals ' online multiplayer should make sure to play as much as possible between now and when it's shut down on October 7.

List of EA Games Shutting Down in 2025

  • Rory McIlroy PGA Tour - January 16
  • The Simpsons: Tapped Out - January 24
  • Blood & Glory Immortals - January 29
  • Contract Killer: Sniper - January 29
  • Deer Hunter Classic - January 29
  • Dino Hunter: Deadly Shores - January 29
  • Eternity Warriors 4 - January 29
  • Frontline Commando 2 - January 29
  • Frontline Commando: D-Day - January 29
  • UFC 3 - February 17
  • EA Sports UFC Mobile 2 - March 13
  • NCAA 14 - March 13
  • Madden NFL 21 - June 30
  • NHL 21 - October 6
  • Need for Speed Rivals - October 7
  • Madden NFL 22 - October 20
  • FIFA 23 - October 30
  • Dirt 3 - November 8
  • Dirt Showdown - November 8
  • Grid Autosport - November 8
  • Grid 2 - November 8
  • EA Sports FC Empires - November 30

Need for Speed Rivals isn't the only EA game shutting down in October. NHL 21 will be shutting down on October 6, while Madden NFL 22 and FIFA 23 are on the chopping block for October 20 and October 30, respectively. More racing games will be shutting down in November, as Dirt 3 , Dirt Showdown , Grid Autosport , and Grid 2 are all shutting down on November 8. Finally, EA Sports FC Empires servers are shutting down on November 30.

It's possible even more EA games will be shutting down this year, but if so, they have yet to be announced. For now, fans of the publisher's games should mark their calendars accordingly and make plans to revisit the online modes of these titles before they disappear forever.

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Early Copies Are Already Out in the Wild
item.description:
Copies of Pokemon Legends: Z-A are already out in the wild, as reports on social media claim that the highly anticipated Nintendo title has somehow reached the hands of a few users. Ergo, Pokemon Legends: Z-A has had its October 16 release date broken by two weeks, though it is unclear how these alleged copies were obtained.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A will take players back to Lumiose City, which was initially explored in Pokemon X and Y . Pokemon Legends: Z-A is an evolution of the franchise, as it will utilize a real-time battle style similar to games like Xenoblade Chronicles . Pokemon Legends: Z-A also marks the return of Mega Evolution as a core battle mechanic, with new Mega-Evolved forms of past Pokemon like Dragonite having been revealed so far. Pokemon Legends: Z-A will also have a Nintendo Switch 2 Edition that offers increased performance and quality.

PSA: Pokemon Legends Z-A Is Already Out In The Wild

While Pokemon Legends: Z-A is already breaking ground with its gameplay changes, the upcoming title has also broken its street release date. As reported by GoNintendo and Kotaku, Twitter user Pory_Leeks stated that copies of Pokemon Legends: Z-A are already in some users' hands. Pory_Leeks shared a picture from a 4chan post that has since been archived. The photo in question showed an apparent glimpse of the trainer character creation menu, with four skin tones each available for male and female avatars to use. No further details about Pokemon Legends: Z-A were posted by Pory_Leeks, other than the fact that Pokemon Legends: Z-A has been obtained by users two weeks ahead of its October 16 launch date.

In response, a Pokemon fan stated that the UI elements in the leaked picture looked similar to ones in official screenshots, lending credence to the original post. Of course, all leaks and rumors must be taken with a pinch of salt until Pokemon Legends: Z-A is officially released. Trainers looking to legitimately pick up a copy of Pokemon Legends: Z-A will have options on launch day. GameStop confirmed that it will host a midnight launch for Pokemon Legends: Z-A , as participating stores will open their doors at 12:00 AM Eastern on October 16 (or 9:00 PM Pacific on October 15).

Fans can pick up their GameStop pre-orders of Pokemon Legends: Z-A and claim an exclusive tote bag while supplies last. As trainers make their battle preparations for Pokemon Legends: Z-A , it remains to be seen how much of the game will be spoiled before October 16.

item.title: World of Warcraft: Midnight Finally Removing Unpopular Endgame Feature
item.description:
World of Warcraft is finally getting rid of Valorstones in Midnight . Once the new World of Warcraft expansion arrives, players will no longer need to collect this unpopular currency in order to upgrade their endgame gear, which will now solely require Crests.

Originally called Flightstones in Dragonflight , Valorstones are a currency in World of Warcraft: The War Within that is required to upgrade equipment to max level. While the gear progression overhauls from these expansions have largely been successful, Valorstones have been the least-popular part of an otherwise functional system.

Valorstones are Gone in World of Warcraft: Midnight

Luckily, fans will never have to worry about Valorstones again once Midnight arrives. World of Warcraft recently held a live Q&A about Midnight , during which game director Ion Hazzikostas spoke on endgame gear progression. Around the 59-minute mark, Hazzikostas admitted the system had â€œone too many moving pieces,â€ and that Valorstones would be retired as a currency starting in Midnight . Once players hit endgame, they will upgrade their gear purely with Crests in World of Warcraft , without needing to obtain a second currency.

Whatâ€™s more, the Crest system itself is going to be streamlined as well. Hazzikostas confirmed plans to simplify Crests to pair each tier of currency with their matching gear power track. This ostensibly means that, instead of certain Crests being used by multiple tiers, Champion track gear will use one type of Crest, Hero track gear another, and so on.

This is a change gamers have been hoping to see in World of Warcraft for years. Valorstones are often sparse at the beginning of an expansion season, but abundant towards the end. This leads to frustrating bottlenecks early, and wasted currency later, as fans often cannot spend enough Valorstones to prevent hitting the cap of 2000. Though WoW letting players keep their Valorstones between The War Within Seasons 2 and 3 was a great first step, many were hoping Blizzard would pull the plug on the unpopular currency, and are overjoyed to see that wish come true in Midnight .

Before they leave, Valorstones are getting a big change in World of Warcraft: The War Within Season 3â€™s Turbo-Boost. The currency will be made Warbound starting October 21, after which they can be freely traded between characters, presumably with the 25% penalty that was present during Season 2. With Season 3 expected to last until the launch of Midnight , this means Valorstones will be account-wide for the remainder of the currencyâ€™s lifespan once the Turbo-Boost begins.

item.title: Borderlands 4: Immortal Boneface (Boss Guide & Legendary Drops)
item.description:
The Meathead Riders hold some of the best Legendary loot in Borderlands 4 , so it's imperative that players know exactly where they can find the Immortal Boneface and Saddleback. This duo of bosses isn't as tough (or immortal) as they claim to be, so get your Vault Hunters ready and prepare to farm these bosses for the incredible loot that they horde. Below, you'll find exactly where to find the Meathead Riders, and what Legendary loot you can expect to farm from them!

How to Find the Immortal Boneface in Borderlands 4

The Old Scrape Walkthrough

The Immortal Boneface is located in "The Old Scrape", a Ripper Drill Site found within Cuspid Climb in the Terminus Range region of Kairos. The Old Scrape is in the south region of Cuspid Climb, just on the connecting cusp to the Fadefields. Once players are here, they will need to navigate through the drawbridge of a giant skeletal creature and venture to the back for the boss fight arena. To summon the Immortal Boneface, you'll need to clear the nest out of Rippers to provoke the Immortal Boneface, but be warned, this boss comes with a partner.

How to Beat Immortal Boneface (& Legendary Drops) in Borderlands 4

All Loot Drops from the Meathead Riders

Legendary

Type

Special Effect

Hellwalker

Shotgun

Soothslayer.

Lucian's Flank

Assault Rifle

Trample - Critical Hits refill up to 2 Ammo to the Gun's Magazine.

War Paint

Repkit

Chrome - On use, grants +30% Fire Rate and +30% Movement Speed for 15s, and reduces Repkit Cooldown by 2s each time Damage is taken.

All of the Immortal Boneface's Legendary loot is worth farming for, but in particular, players are going to want the War Paint Repkit. War Paint boosts Fire Rate, Movement Speed, and reduces Repkit Cooldown on each use, which can greatly stack for builds that rely on Fire Rate to nearly one-shot bosses. The Hellwalker Shotgun is also great, simply because it hits hard and is a fun reference to DOOM. lastly, there is Lucian's Flank, which is an Assault Rifle that refills 2 Ammo to the Magazine per Critical Hit, which basically means an infinite Ammo Assault Rifle for players who hit Critical Hits.

In order to actually fight the Immortal Boneface, you first need to kill Saddleback, who is hiding the other boss. Saddleback is a large Meathead and has 2 health bars. The first is Armor, so use Corrosive and Cryo. The second is Flesh, so use Incendiary. With Saddleback dead, the Immortal Boneface isn't so immortal, and his first health bar is Shield, so use Shock, and his second is also Flesh, so another round of Incendiary will prove his mortality.

item.title: Borderlands 4: Callis (Boss Guide & Legendary Drops)
item.description:
Callis the Ripper Queen is the reason so many of Kairos's population have gone mad, and now it's time to make her go even madder by killing her over and over for her Legendary drops. Players can find Callis in Borderlands 4 within a specific area, and she also has a dedicated loot pool that you really won't want to miss out on, for she drops some extremely useful items, and Class Mods that might serve to make your build a power house worth fearing. Check out where to find Callis and what Legendary drops she has, below!

How to Find Callis in Borderlands 4

Moon-Called Throne Walkthrough

Callis the Ripper Queen becomes a farmable boss once players complete the Main Mission "Her Flaming Vision" through the Carcadia Burn questline. After, players can head to the Moon-Called Throne in Fallen Crown, Carcadia Burn, where they can activate Moxxi's Encore to re-fight Callis over and over again in search of her loot. Below, we've uploaded a video walkthrough of Moon-Called Throne so you know where to go and how to reach Callis, along with a quick demonstration of how to efficiently farm her!

How to Beat Callis (& Legendary Drops) in Borderlands 4

All Loot Drops from Callis

Legendary

Type

Special Effect

Pandoran Memento

Shield

Psychosis - When damaged, grants +15% Elemental Resistance and +50% Resistance to the last Damage Type received for 5s.

Queen's Rest

Pistol

Royal Armory - Fires high-speed rounds, and damaging enemies has a 30% Chance to spawn a Homing Sticky Projectiles.

Esgrimidor

Rafa Class Mod

Rafa's Melee Attacks gain a +10% Critical Hit Chance. Critical Hits with Melee Attacks restore +5% of Action Skill Duration.

Illusionist

Vex Class Mod

Specters and Reapers have a chance to be Badasses, gaining increased Maximum Health and Damage Dealt. This chance increases the longer it hasn't occurred and will at least occur once every 90 seconds.

Skeptic

Harlowe Class Mod

Whenever Harlowe Slams an enemy in Stasis, she automatically fires Radiation Darts and Cryo Darts that home in on enemies. Shooting enemies with an active Status Effect restores 5% of Action Skill Cooldown.

Viking

Amon Class Mod

Crucible gains +2 Charges, increases Duration, and grants Amon increased Damage Reduction while active.

Callis drops a bundle of items, and of the bunch, the Pistol, Queen's Rest, is really good. This is a fun Pistol for players who like that weapon type, as it fires high-speed rounds that have a 30% chance to spawn a Homing Sticky Projectile. Outside of the Pistol, players might want to farm Callis for the Class Mods she drops for each Vault Hunter to see if they work for their builds.

Callis is a simple fight, as her first health bar is Armor, so bring Corrosive and Cryo weapons to easily melt it. For her second health bar, she has Flesh, so Incendiary will do the trick. Callis will stomp around the arena with her metallic legs, and each stomp provides lava waves to watch out for. Callis can also behave like a spider and become invulnerable while she makes you fight Rippers, but simply waiting her out and damaging her again will ensure she's a fast and effective kill.
